name: Kubernetes
description: Self-contained Kubernetes management skill with real kubectl integration. 18 tools for pods, deployments, services, and more.
longDescription:
Comprehensive, self-contained Kubernetes cluster management through native kubectl execution. This agentic skill provides 18+ kubectl tools for managing your clusters, including resource management (pods, deployments, services), log viewing, scaling, rollouts, and node operations. Perfect for DevOps teams managing containerized workloads.

**When to Use:**
- Managing Kubernetes resources (pods, deployments, services, configmaps, secrets)
- Viewing pod logs and debugging containers
- Scaling deployments up or down
- Managing cluster configuration and contexts
- Performing rollout operations (restart, undo, status)
- Node management (cordon, uncordon, drain, taint)

services.name: kubectl-proxy
services.description: Kubernetes API proxy for executing commands

tools.name: get
tools.description: Get Kubernetes resources (pods, deployments, services, nodes, etc.)

parameters.name: resource
parameters.description: Resource type (pods, services, deployments, nodes, namespaces, configmaps, secrets, ingress, pv, pvc, jobs, cronjobs, daemonsets, statefulsets, replicasets, events, endpoints, all)

parameters.name: tail
parameters.description: Number of lines to show from end

tools.name: scale
tools.description: Scale a deployment, replicaset, or statefulset

examples.title: List all pods in default namespace
examples.description: Get a quick overview of all running pods

examples.title: View pods across all namespaces
examples.description: See all pods in your cluster
examples.code: skill run kubernetes:get resource=pods namespace=all output=wide

examples.title: View pod logs
examples.description: Tail the last 100 lines of logs from a specific pod

examples.title: Scale a deployment
examples.description: Scale the nginx deployment to 3 replicas
examples.code: skill run kubernetes:scale resource=deployment name=nginx replicas=3
